item.title: Stock market today: 124 stocks hit 52-week highs, 64 stocks at 52-week low as Nifty 50, Sensex end in red

review.headline_rewrite: Stock market today: 124 stocks hit 52-week highs, 64 stocks at 52-week low as Nifty 50, Sensex end in red
bullets: Stock market today: On Tuesday, 124 stocks hit their 52-week high, including Bosch Ltd, Eicher Motors Ltd, HBL Engineering Ltd, Maharashtra Scooters Ltd, MRF
In contrast, 64 stocks touched 52-week lows, with notable mentions Deepak Nitrite Ltd, Five-Star Business Finance Ltd, Praveg Ltd, Sprayking Ltd, Vikas EcoTech Ltd,

item.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 fall on fag-end profit booking— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today

review.headline_rewrite: Sensex, Nifty 50 fall on fag-end profit booking— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
bullets: The Indian stock market benchmarks, the Sensex and the Nifty 50, ended in the red on profit booking in the fag-end of the session,
The Sensex closed at 80,157.88, down 207 points, or 0.26 per cent, while the Nifty 50 ended the day with a loss of 45
The BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices outperformed, rising 0.27 per cent and 0.64 per cent, respectively.
The overall market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms rose to nearly ₹450 lakh crore from nearly ₹449 lakh crore in the previous session, thanks to

item.title: India’s ageing wind infra has potential to unlock 25.4 GW capacity

review.headline_rewrite: India’s ageing wind infra has potential to unlock 25.4 GW capacity
bullets: The Centre for Science and Environment’s (CSE) in a report explored the urgent need to repower, replace old, low-capacity turbines with modern, high-capacity ones,
It highlights structural barriers that hinder repowering, from fragmented ownership to outdated evacuation systems, and calls for a coordinated, policy-backed response.
The report underscores that without targeted policy support, financial incentives, and regulatory reforms, developers are unlikely to independently pursue repowering initiatives.
Tamil Nadu alone operates more than 8,800 turbines totalling 6.25 GW, many of which rely on obsolete technology.

item.title: Solfin partners with Japanese financial institution to expand solar finance access

bullets: The shares of Waaree Energies Limited were trading on the NSE today at ₹3,203.50 up by ₹3 or 0.09 per cent at 3.20 pm.
